messages.subject: Re: Anyone in Florida?
messages.msgSnippet: Lesa, I am in South Florida, Miami to be precise.  What part of Florida are you moving to? If you are moving to South Florida (Dade, Broward or Palm Beach
messages.messageBody:
Lesa,

I am in South Florida, Miami to be precise. What part of Florida are
you moving to?

If you are moving to South Florida (Dade, Broward or Palm Beach
county), we have unschooling yahoo! group. If you would like to join,
the name of the yahoo! group is RUBROWARD. There is also an
unschooling yahoo! group for the whole state of Florida: FLUNSCHOOLING.

Kind regards,
Anna

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "lesa" <rhavensunflower@...>
wrote:
>
> HI! My name is Lesa. I am a lurker right now. I have been
> homeschooling for a year now. I am very interested in Unschooling and
> have seen many benefits from it in my children. I am in the process of
> moving to Florida from Arkansas and I need to find out how to legally
> unschool here. Thanks!!!
>
> Lesa
>

messages.subject: Re: Anyone in Florida?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Lesa (I answered you at UB also) I moved to Florida (Ocala) from NYC in 2002. There are 2 ways to homeschool in this state. One is through the state and one
messages.messageBody:
Hi Lesa (I answered you at UB also)

I moved to Florida (Ocala) from NYC in 2002.

There are 2 ways to homeschool in this state. One is through the
state and one is through a 600/non-public school.

Through the state, you have to submit a yearly portfolio and have
your child evaluated.
Through a 600 school, you follow the rules of that school. The only
procedure a 600 school is required by law to follow is that they
collect attendence (180 dates). If they have any other rules, those
are their own rules that they decided on.
I belong to AEI. Here is the link:
http://alternativeeducationinstitute.org/index.htm
The only requirement they have is collecting attendence, which you
send in through an e-mail. You can pass on the health
exam/immunization part for religious or moral reasons.
The woman who runs the school, also runs a very informative yahoo
group on Florida homeschooling laws. Here is the link:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/FL-HomeEducation-Law/

Please feel free to contact me if you need more information!

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (11) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/
http://foreverparents.com

messages.subject: Anyone in Florida?
messages.msgSnippet: HI! My name is Lesa. I am a lurker right now. I have been homeschooling for a year now. I am very interested in Unschooling and have seen many benefits from it
messages.messageBody:
HI! My name is Lesa. I am a lurker right now. I have been
homeschooling for a year now. I am very interested in Unschooling and
have seen many benefits from it in my children. I am in the process of
moving to Florida from Arkansas and I need to find out how to legally
unschool here. Thanks!!!

Lesa
